bibl.title: Howard McMillen v. O. D. Butterfield. Chief of Police Message
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
PACIFIC POSTAL TELEGRAPH-CABLE CO In connection with the Commercial Mackay-Bennett CABLES
Errors can be guarded against only by repeating a message back to the sending station for comparison, and the Company will not hold itself liable for errors or delays in transmission or delivery at UNREPEATED MESSAGES, beyond the amount of tolls paid thereon; xer in any case whee the claim is not presented in writing within sixty days after sending the message. This is an UNREPEATED MESSAGE, and is delivered by request of the sender under the conditions named above. JOHN W. MACKAY, President. CHAS. R. HOSMER, Gen'l Manager. W. C. VAN HORNE, Vice-President. L. W. STORROR, Superintendent. NUMBER SENT BY EXPD BY CHECK 12 po 0 12 9 pacs

Van Louven Be 9 Rec'd at SEATTLE W. Ha To Chief Police May 9 1889
Will have on Premier today with witnesses to prosecute
Chief of Police
